page.title: 01GREAT LONGSTONE AND DISTRICT
page.content: {Great Longstone} is in the Peak District National Park just north of the Market town of Bakewell. In 1985 the population of the village is approx 984. The hamlets of Little Longstone, Rowland and Monsal Dale surround the village. The Village of Ashford in the Water is close by. In the Village of Great Longstone there are approx 300 houses, dating from the conquest to the present day. In the past lead mining and quarrying has taken place, especially in the Longstone Edge area. The area is now mostly farmland with the exception of the Thornhill's Country Produce Factory. Plans have been put forward to build 34 new houses which will be 'starter homes' and elderly persons houses. Monsal Head is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the area.
